title: Senior Data Scientist / Software developer
description:
**At Actemium Energy AI, based in Gothenburg, we specialize in developing AI-driven solutions for the industrial sector. We combine engineering expertise with advanced data science and software development to create tools that help industries optimize processes, reduce costs, and accelerate innovation.**

 **We Are Looking For**  

We are now seeking a Data Scientist / Software Developer with at least 5 years of experience to strengthen our growing team. You will work closely with our engineers to design, develop, and deploy AI solutions that bring real impact to industrial clients.

**Your Profile**

* MSc or PH.d in Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or related field.
* 5+ years of professional experience in data science, software development, or applied AI.
* Strong skills in Python (and preferably one other language, e.g. C++ or JavaScript).
* Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
* Solid understanding of data handling and visualization (SQL, Pandas, Matplotlib/Plotly).
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and modern development workflows (Git, CI/CD, Docker).
* Ability to work independently and in a team, with a problem-solving mindset.

**Nice-to-Have**

* Experience with time series data or industrial process data.
* Knowledge of simulation, optimization, or digital twins.
* Exposure to software productization (scaling prototypes into usable products).

**What We Offer**

* A chance to work on cutting-edge AI projects with real industrial applications.
* An innovative environment where you can influence both technology and business.
* Collaboration with a skilled team of engineers and data scientists.
* Opportunities for professional development and career growth.
* A friendly and supportive workplace in the heart of Gothenburg.

**Application Process**


Send your application including a CV and a cover letter describing why you are interested in working with us and how your background and skills match our needs.


We look forward to hearing from you and exploring the possibilities together!

 **About Actemium:**  

*Actemium, VINCI Energies' industry-focused brand, is part of the global VINCI Group. Operating worldwide, Actemium comprises 400 units in 40 countries with 22,000+ employees. In Sweden, 30 business units and 1200 employees form a leading automation and electrical technology brand. Specializing in electricity and instrumentation installations, we excel in industrial precision, primarily serving industrial clients while undertaking complex contracts in other segments.*

title: Utvecklare Optimizely
description:
**Att jobba som Utvecklare Optimizely**


Som Optimizelyutvecklare i vårt team Everweb blir du en nyckelspelare i vår stora satsning på digital transformation. Dina arbetsuppgifter består av att:

* Utveckla och driva Skandias webbplatser inom Optimizely CMS
* Stötta och supporta interna redaktörer
* Möjliggöra smidig innehållshantering för både externa och interna webbar samt appar
* Ansvara för teknisk design och delta i kravdiskussioner


Du kommer till ett starkt och erfaret team av utvecklare och testare som arbetar tillsammans med design, utveckling, testautomatisering och automatiserade deploy:er. En arbetsmiljö där mobb- och parprogrammering samt gemensam kravrefinering är en självklarhet och en kultur som präglas av glädje, humor och stark gemenskap.

 **För att lyckas i rollen**


Vi söker dig som har:

* Gedigen erfarenhet av .NET, Optimizely CMS (fd Episerver) och frontendutveckling
* Passion för programmering, problemlösning och struktur
* Ett öga för helheten och konsumenternas behov
* Intresse för automatisering av tester och deploy:er


Meriterande erfarenheter:  

Optimizely CMS 12, Headless CMS, TypeScript, React, Octopus Deploy och Azure DevOps.


Vi tror att du är en självgående lagspelare som tar initiativ, gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap och låter glädje och humor bli en naturlig del av vardagen.

**Vad händer nu?**


Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.


Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Stephan Mannerfelt på mailadress stephan.mannerfelt@skandia.se


Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

**Mer om IT**


Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!


Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.


Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Java Developer
description:
**ComeOn Group in short**
 Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Operating more than 20 brands on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.
   

  

**The Website**
 The ComeOn.com website is a service-oriented web application with stability, high performance and user experience being top priority. The frontend is optimized for a multi-device web solution and the tech stack consists of HTML5, CSS3/4, JavaScript with React. For client side state management we make use of Redux. On the server side, the business logic is proprietary developed Java code together with open source frameworks and external integration modules. The database is a MySQL cluster with distributed and dedicated report servers and data warehouse. We are continuously looking for new technologies and innovative solutions to use in order to offer a very competitive gaming experience for our customers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 We are looking for a Java Developer to help us build the best gambling site on the Internet. In this role, you'll work across the full system stack and all stages of the development lifecycle in a collaborative, team-driven environment. You will be responsible for integrating with external systems, developing internal components and subsystems, and contributing to frontend development for both mobile and desktop platforms. You'll work closely with our business teams to design and deliver new features, leveraging modern technologies such as Java, Kafka, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, React, and Spring Boot, with deployments as Debian packages or in Kubernetes. The role also involves navigating and improving a codebase built over 15 years by around 60 developers, finding safe and incremental ways to modernize it without introducing risk.
   

  

**Requirements**
**About you:**
* Strong Java skills and genuinely passionate about it
* You understand that reading code is more difficult than writing code
* At least 6 years of professional software development experience
* Experience building web applications and services
* SQL Knowledge
* You know how to get legacy code under test
* Curious and willing to share and exchange knowledge with team members
* Comfortable working in an agile team with developers, QA engineers, and product owners
* Experience with any of the following is a plus: Tomcat, Maven, Spring, MongoDB, Guava, Guice, MySQL, Nginx, Linux, Jenkins, Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform
* Fluent in spoken and written English


**Benefits**
**So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?**
 ComeOn offers a competitive and consistent benefits package for our team members. While some benefits vary by location due to local needs and regulations, many are available company-wide, and we're proud to offer them to everyone:
   

  

* Fantastic quarterly or half-yearly team events
* Regular company events
* A 250 euro One-time Hybrid Allowance to help you set up your home office (or equivalent in local currency)
* Annual wellbeing allowance/ gym membership (location dependent)
* 40 days ‘Work from Another Location' (WFAL) entitlement to work from any other location around the world
* Regular Meals at the office


 At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.
   

  

 At ComeOn Group, we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assessing candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.
   

  

 Want to know more about us? Just visit any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 Glassdoor

title: Software Engineer - General
description:
**Join a Seed-Stage AI Startup Transforming Legal Compliance**
**About Kalipso**
 Join a seed-stage AI startup working with Europe's biggest FinTechs and banks to revolutionize regulatory compliance. We're building AI-powered tools to make regulatory compliance simple, transparent, and reliable for enterprises. Founded by ex-lawyers who were tired of working like in the 70s, and a top-tier ex-Klarna AI engineer who built one of the world's most advanced AI strategies.
   

  

 Our platform is built on European standards, with a strong focus on trust, data security, and a deep understanding of legal complexity. We're transforming legal and regulatory compliance from boring to empowering, and are backed by fantastic investors who are propelling us to the top of the market.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a
 **Software Engineer** 
 at Kalipso, you'll join our small, high-delivery team focusing on your main area: backend, frontend, full stack, or data and AI. You'll build the core systems that major financial institutions depend on to accelerate their business and save millions a year.
   

  

**What you will be doing:**
* Build core features in your specialty - backend systems, intuitive frontends, data pipelines, or advanced AI
* We believe that every employee deserves to understand the problem first hand, hence, you will get the opportunity to meet our clients and build what they truly want
* Design and implement systems that handle sensitive confidential documents at scale
* Collaborate closely with founders and our tight-knit engineering team
* Write clean, maintainable code that meets the highest security and compliance standards
* Shape product direction based on real customer feedback


**Who You Are**
* Proficient in Python, TypeScript, Go, or similar modern languages
* Comfortable working with APIs, databases, and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
* Bonus if you have experience with AI/ML, legal tech, or financial services
* Ideally have at least 2 years of experience, or can demonstrate strong skills in your area
* But most importantly, you are someone who:
+ Gets stuff done and understands that building transformative compliance tech requires dedication and hard work
+ Proactively solves the most critical problems facing our clients
+ Thrives in a fast-paced environment where you're building solutions that didn't exist before
+ Takes ownership and drives results in a small team setting


**What's In It For You**
* Join at seed stage with direct access to founders and major influence on company direction
* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving fintech/AI environment
* Have a voice in shaping the product and strategy
* Be part of a small, high-delivery team where your ideas are valued and implemented quickly
* Competitive salary complemented with meaningful equity in a company solving real problems
* Flexible hybrid work setup with offices in Stockholm and Barcelona


 Join us and let's build something that matters.

title: Software developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* BSc or MSc Computer science, electronic engineering or similar technical degree:
* Strong knowledge of Linux.
* Container technologies in Linux systems.
* Container knowledge: Docker, Podman, Nerdctrl or similar
* Database knowledge: postgres, mysql, NoSQL
* Solid agile working for example knowing how to write DoD/DoR, acceptance criteria, story point complexity estimation, velocity
* Planning with Jira and estimating tasks with SMART goals
* Experience with CI/CD for example CI-tools (Jenkins or runners).
* Pipelines with build, testing (unit, integration, end-to-end), SAST, DAST, release of artifactory, deploying to staging/production
* Version control GIT, Subcersion or similar
* Experience with artifact stores.
* Applications: Mattermost, SonarQube, Jenkins, Confluence, Vault
* Programming languages: Python, Perl, Bash, Yaml or any other common language


**Meritorious**
* DevSecOps with security first
* Scanning av third-party libraries, container images for vulnerabilities
* Algorithm and management of system communication with difference protocols
* Agentic AI development nice to have,
* API protocol REST, GraphQL , OpenAPI, XML or simular
* Databasmigration tools Flyway, LiquidBase
* AWS, Azure, GCP


**Application deadline:** 
 10-10-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Frontend Developer
company_industry: Software Development and IT System Design Services
description:
I am looking for
 *Swedish speaking* 
 Frontend developers in Stockholm to join a mid-sized company in the public sector. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in React, TypeScript, and modern CSS practices, building accessible and scalable applications that make a real impact. Bonus points if you've worked with Turborepo, React Router 7, Azure Container Apps, or TailwindCSS.
 



  





 This is a really exciting time to join as the team are undergoing a major transformation project, modernising their IT systems and completely rebuilding their web applications. This means you have an amazing opportunity to make a genuine meaningful impact to the development and business.
 



  





**Key Responsiblities:** 




  




* Design, develop, and maintain high quality frontend applications for public-facing and internal applications
* Implement responsive and accessible UIs using React, TypeScript, and CSS.
* Collaborate with the C# backend and infrastructure teams to ensure seamless integrations.
* Contribute to the performance, scalability, and security of frontend applications.



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* 4+ years' experience working with
 **React** 
 and
 **TypeScript**
* Strong skills in
 **CSS** 
 (modern frameworks, responsive design, accessibility best practices)
* Experience with
 **Git**
* Understanding of frontend software development best practices
* Bonus: experience with
 **Turborepo, React Router 7, Azure Container Apps, or TailwindCSS.**



  





*This role requires candidates to speak fluent Swedish and unfortunately cannot assist with visa sponsorships.* 




  





**Why join?** 




  




* As a company in the public sector, you're input will massively contribute to Swedish social improvement and sustainability.
* Although this is a Swedish company, they are part of international communities offering the chance for global collaboration and conferences.
* The upcoming modernization and digitalization projects offer you the chance to make a real impact on the organisation and your career growth.
* Supportive, team-oriented culture with a focus on making a positive impact.



  





 For more information, please apply and I will be in touch.

title: Utvecklare Optimizely
description:
**Att jobba som Utvecklare Optimizely** 




 Som Optimizelyutvecklare i vårt team Everweb blir du en nyckelspelare i vår stora satsning på digital transformation. Dina arbetsuppgifter består av att:
 


* Utveckla och driva Skandias webbplatser inom Optimizely CMS
* Stötta och supporta interna redaktörer
* Möjliggöra smidig innehållshantering för både externa och interna webbar samt appar
* Ansvara för teknisk design och delta i kravdiskussioner



 Du kommer till ettstarkt och erfaret team av utvecklare och testare som arbetar tillsammans meddesign, utveckling, testautomatisering och automatiserade deploy:er. En arbetsmiljö där mobb- och parprogrammering samt gemensam kravrefinering är en självklarhet och en kultur som präglas av glädje, humor och stark gemenskap.
   





**För att lyckas i rollen** 




 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* Gedigen erfarenhet av .NET, Optimizely CMS (fd Episerver) och frontendutveckling
* Passion för programmering, problemlösning och struktur
* Ett öga för helheten och konsumenternas behov
* Intresse för automatisering av tester och deploy:er



 Meriterande erfarenheter:
   

 Optimizely CMS 12, Headless CMS, TypeScript, React, Octopus Deploy och Azure DevOps.
 



 Vi tror att du är en självgående lagspelare som tar initiativ, gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap och låter glädje och humor bli en naturlig del av vardagen.
 



**Vad händer nu?** 




 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
 



 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Stephan Mannerfelt på mailadress stephan.mannerfelt@skandia.se  
 



 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



**Mer om IT** 




 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
 



 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
 



 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Software Engineer - Web Solutions
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

 As a
 **Software Engineer for Web Solutions** 
 , you will bring your technical knowledge and experience into a team of software, test automation, and quality assurance engineers. You will routinely collaborate with your peers both within your own and other software teams to ensure adherence to common software development standards and practices.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Drive software development efforts in our web-based solutions, in close collaboration with peers and team members.
* Maintain and enhance existing web solutions with a focus on quality, stability, and maintainability.
* Contribute to building our next generation of web-based solutions, following modern design patterns and best practices.
* Commit to understanding and applying design patterns, software architectures, dependencies, and system interfaces.
* Take an active role in team discussions, planning, and prioritization to promote a healthy and efficient way of working.
* Ensure software meets high standards of quality, security, maintainability, and extensibility.


**What We're Looking For:**
* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
* At least 3 years of experience building and delivering modern web solutions.
* Proven full-stack development experience: building both installable and web-based solutions using .NET.
* Solid experience with databases and data modeling.
* Working knowledge of software quality assurance principles and development best practices.
* A technical mindset with a strong attention to detail.


**Additional Skills and Requirements:**
* A structured approach to both short- and long-term development planning.
* Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills to navigate requirements from multiple disciplines.
* A respectful, professional, and values-driven mindset in line with Tobii Dynavox culture.
* Flexible, collaborative, and hands-on working style.
* Based in or around Stockholm, with the ability to meet and work from the office as needed.


 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Java Developer
description:
DCT Are you ready to be at the forefront of digital innovation? Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate.
   

  

 Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and front-end development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are a backend team at Tele2 where we have several critical services supporting the organization. For example, we process all real-time payments, have services updating all our customers.
   

  

***Who are you?***
 As a person you understand the big picture and you are willing to learn, you are ready to walk the extra mile to ensure a high-quality product.
   

  

 The daily job will include contact with several different teams and departments, and we believe you have excellent collaboration and communication skills. As a person, you are open, proactive and are not afraid to take your own initiative.
   

  

***What you will do:***
 Work in an agile setup, to be curious and open, helpful and collaborative, have in depth knowledge in branch standards and stay up to date in our field of technology.
   

  

***How we work:***
 To better understand the business requirements, we work closely with business owners. We work with agile methods, continuous delivery on a sprint basis.
   

  

 We believe that you have experience in:
   

  

* Java
* Spring boot
* Azure cloud
* DevOps
* MongoDB
* K8s
* CI/CD


 Meriting skills:
   

  

* Kafka
* EventstoreDB
* AXON Framework
* Helm
* Terraform

title: Product Developer
description:
*Are you ready to take the lead in developing innovative and high-quality women’s light woven products? Join our dynamic team as a Product Developer, where you will play a key role in transforming creative design visions into market-ready collections. You will be part of a small, highly skilled team working closely with our designers and technical experts, as well as collaborating with specialists across women’s, men’s and home. This is a temporary role of 12 to 14 months.*
**Responsibilities**
 As a Product Developer for women's light woven, you will play a critical role in the entire product lifecycle, from initial design concepts to commercialization. Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Product development: Develop light woven products that meet our high standards for quality, price, and timing. You'll be the bridge between design, sourcing, and suppliers, ensuring smooth communication and adherence to timelines.
* Sourcing and negotiation: Proactively source high-quality materials and negotiate prices and lead times with suppliers, ensuring products align with our range plan and business goals.
* Quality assurance: Oversee quality testing for materials, trims, and samples, ensuring the final products meet our standards and the needs of our customers.
* Collaboration: Work closely with designers, buyers, and suppliers to ensure that the development process is efficient and clear to all parties involved.
* Market and sales awareness: Stay informed about sales performance, competitive trends, and the latest developments in the knitwear market to ensure our collections are always ahead of the curve.
* Sustainability: Drive the development of products with sustainability at the forefront, ensuring eco-friendly processes and materials are prioritized.


 We are looking for someone with a true passion for knitwear and a drive for excellence.
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in product development, with a strong focus on light woven.
* A university degree in textiles or a related field
* Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with designers, suppliers, and cross-functional teams.
* A proactive, flexible, and problem-solving mindset – you thrive in dynamic environments and can pivot when needed while maintaining focus on key objectives.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and PLM Database Systems


  

  

 Apply with your CV in English by 2025/10/25. Our team reviews applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today! Please note that this is a temporary position between 12 to 14 months and the position may be filled before the set end date.
   

  

 GANT stands as an emblem of American Sportswear, symbolizing timeless style and innovation across 70+ global markets. As a company, we blend heritage with contemporary flair, crafting apparel for the bold, the curious, and the imaginative. Our brand represents more than fashion; it's a tradition of excellence and authenticity. As an employer, we foster a culture of continuous learning and creativity, inviting high performers to join our diverse team of innovators. At GANT, we're not just shaping the future of fashion; we're redefining what it means to dress with purpose and passion.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Passionate about cutting-edge technology and making the world more sustainable at the same time?** 
 Join us at Worldfavor, where our mission is to make 
 **sustainable business mainstream** 
 . 🌱
 



  





 We are a leading global SaaS platform where users can easily share, access, and gain insights into corporate sustainability data. Having expanded rapidly, Worldfavor now connects over 30,000 businesses across 140 countries. We work with a range of renowned clients, from Nordic leaders to global Fortune 500 companies. We're on an exhilarating growth journey to become the market leader and expand our global reach.
 



  





 At Worldfavor, you'll be part of a 
 **diverse and dynamic team** 
  of intelligent, fun-loving, and ambitious individuals who share a common 
 **passion** 
  for leveraging technology to foster a sustainable world. We value sustainable living and working, and we celebrate both significant and minor milestones. Our team ethos always prioritizes collective achievements over individual victories.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Fullstack engineer (with a frontend focus), you are at the heart of our engineering process. You’ll develop high-quality, scalable, and predictive software solutions primary with React but also work with .NET/C# in the backend.
 



  





 You will be responsible for:
 


* Designing, developing, and maintaining robust software that meets client sustainability needs.
* Collaborating cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Customer Support teams to enhance product features and improve user experience.
* Driving innovation and efficiency through continuous integration, continuous deployment, and automated testing.
* Troubleshooting, debugging, and upgrading existing software.



  





**Who Are You?** 




 We are seeking a proactive, tech-savvy individual with:
 


* **3+ years of professional experience** 
  building production-grade software, primarily with 
 **React** 
  or similar frontend technologies.
* Knowledge of C# or similar languages (such as Kotlin or Java) and relational databases.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of architecting high-performance systems.
* Fluency in English; Swedish is a plus.



  





 Ideally, you are an innovative person who enjoys experimenting with new technologies. You work well with others and inspire those around you through your expertise. You are able to communicate complex ideas in a clear way to non-technical stakeholders, and you thrive in a fast-paced and ever-evolving environment.
 



  





 Like all team members at Worldfavor, we expect you to be ambitious, humble, have a "can-do attitude", take ownership, and be driven by the desire to shape a more sustainable world.
 



  





 We recruit, work, and promote based on 
 **our core values** 
 :
 


* We make an 
 **impact.**
* We take 
 **ownership.**
* We always 
 **evolve.**
* We’re in it 
 **together.**
* We believe anything is 
 **possible.**



  





 At Worldfavor, you’ll be part of an exciting scale-up journey with ambitious global plans, giving you exceptional opportunities to grow your career as we expand. Our vibrant Impact House in the heart of Stockholm offers an inspiring place to work together and make an impact. We value wellbeing and balance, which is why we provide six weeks of paid vacation plus five additional paid days off, along with a competitive pension and generous health benefits. To encourage continuous growth, we also offer a personal development contribution that allows you to pursue learning in the areas that inspire you most.
 



  





**Sounds Like a Match?** 




 Apply on our career site: https://worldfavor.careers.haileyhr.app. We are excited to learn what drives you!
 



  





*We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process to ensure a safe and trusted working environment.*

title: Software Developer – High Performance Computing
description:
We are looking for a skilled software developer to join our team dedicated to creating advanced algorithms in the field of High Performance Computing. The majority of our development work is done in C++, with some use of Java.COMSOL develops cutting-edge mathematical modeling software that powers innovations in physics and engineering. Our flagship product, COMSOL Multiphysics®, is widely used across all fields of engineering, manufacturing, and scientific research to model multiphysics systems. Our customers leverage our software to understand, predict, and optimize product designs and processes. Founded in Sweden in 1986, COMSOL has expanded globally with 16 offices and a distributor network, employing more than 500 people worldwide.Based in our newly renovated office in central Stockholm, the team is responsible for developing the High Performance Computing (HPC) part in all COMSOL’s products that take advantage of distributed memory on clusters, shared memory on multi-core and multiple CPU machines and the support for GPUs. Our goal is to enable efficient finite-element (FEM) computations on large scale applications.You will work with advanced algorithms for solving linear and non-linear equations. Responsibilities include writing and reviewing code, contributing to project specifications and design, and testing new functionality.We are looking for developers with the following qualifications:
   

  

* PhD, MSc or equivalent degree in scientific computing.
* Experience in writing efficient algorithms using CUDA for GPUs and MPI for High Performance Computing.
* Experience in OpenMP is a plus.
* You must be eligible to work in Sweden, but Swedish is not a requirement as long as you have excellent English skills.


 At COMSOL, new team members quickly become essential contributors to ongoing development projects. As the company continues to expand, there are plenty of opportunities for employees to advance in their roles and become leading experts in their areas of focus. This journey will be accompanied by experienced colleagues and a collaborative working environment.In addition to an exciting career working on a sophisticated software product, we offer:
   

  

* A competitive salary
* Individual pension plans
* Sponsored gym membership
* Great work-life balance


 To ensure a smooth onboarding process, onsite presence is required. Once onboarded, hybrid work options are available.Does this sound interesting? Submit your application, including university grades, using the form below. Kindly note that applications submitted through other channels will not be considered.We review applications continuously.

title: Backend developer - Java/Kotlin
description:
We are looking for a skilled and communicative developer to our client within Fin-tech.
   

  

 In this role, you will collaborate with a crowd of bright people co-tackling a wide variety of technical challenges and driven by a shared ambition to create hassle-free solutions for our sellers.
   

  

**Your day to day:**
 Develop clean, maintainable, high-quality Java or Kotlin code.
   

  

 Take ownership of the delivery – your own, and your peer engineers in the team.
   

  

 Design, build, deploy, and maintain services powering their customer experiences.
   

  

 Collaborate with other skilled and motivated engineers on the team as well as product and design to deliver a world-class experience.
   

  

 Continuously raise the bar on the quality and customer focus in the products we develop.
   

  

**What You Need To Succeed**
 Proven / Practical experience of developing back-end services in Java, AWS, Docker and Kotlin.
   

  

 Focus on delivery, attention to detail and quality of the end result.
   

  

 Practical experience of designing, building and maintaining distributed systems in a cloud-native environment. Experience working in an agile development team, using common tools like Jira and GitHub.
   

  

 Examples of growing yourself and/or people around you – learning from others and sharing your knowledge, experiences and opinions.
   

  

**Experience in cloud infrastructure (we primarily use AWS). Get bonus points if you also have... Familiarity with FinTech industry payment transactions.**
 Start: ASAP
   

  

 End: 27/3/2026 - extension is a possibility
   

  

 Workplace: Stockholm with a hybrid setup of 2-3 days onsite.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
**Job Title: BI Developer** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden - Hybrid: 3 Days to Office Every Week** 




**Duration: 6 Months (Extendable)** 




**Employment Type: Contract B2B** 




  





**Roles & Responsibilities:** 




 We are looking for a Data Warehouse Consultant to join our team. You will help design, develop, and maintain ETL processes, and support our data warehouse environment. You will collaborate closely with other data engineers and analysts to ensure high quality data delivery in an Agile environment.
 



**Who You Are:** 




 Experienced with Teradata and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI).
 



 Skilled in ETL development and maintenance.
 



 Familiar with Agile ceremonies (stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives) and PI planning.
 



 Passionate about improving processes and enabling teams to work efficiently.
 



 Collaborative and open to sharing knowledge in a caring team environment.

title: Software Engineer - AI/LLM
description:
Rillion is seeking a skilled Software Engineer to join our innovative and cross-functional AI product team. In this role, you’ll be pivotal in developing AI-powered products within AP (Accounts Payable) automation and enhancing our existing products. Together, we collaborate across the entire product lifecycle—from brainstorming and design to implementation—unlocking AI’s potential in AP automation. If you’re an experienced Software Engineer with AI/LLM experience who thrives in a dynamic environment, we’d love to have you on board!
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 




 You will play a key role in building and integrating AI-powered functionalities into our SaaS products, focusing on backend development and scalable architecture:
 


* Develop and maintain Python backend solutions and APIs for a new product based on a document processing pipeline.
* Integrate external LLM-based AI services (OpenAI, Azure AI) into our products.
* Ensure scalability and reliability with cloud-based architectures, infrastructure as code (IaC), and automation (preferably in Azure).
* Work closely with a cross-functional team to embed AI into our SaaS platform.
* Stay up to date with LLM advancements and help shape how we use AI.



  





**What You'll Bring:** 



* Solid backend development experience (Python) in SaaS or online product environments.
* Hands-on cloud experience (preferably Azure) with containers and IaC.
* Experience working with distributed systems, including APIs, message queues, and worker-based architectures.
* A problem-solving mindset and a collaborative, proactive approach that thrives in working in a team.
* Experience with AI/LLM APIs and external AI services.
* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.



  





**Bonus skills:** 



* Experience with RAG, tooling, observability, and LLM evaluation.
* Experience with front-end development (React) and UI/UX considerations.
* Experience with AI/ML frameworks, e.g. Pytorch, and machine learning.



  





**What we offer:** 



* Opportunity to work in a dynamic growth company
* Join a collaborative and supportive product team that will be responsible for the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to production.
* Talented colleagues ready to support the success in your career path
* Social events with your colleagues (breakfast, candy-time, afterwork etc.)
* A collection of different benefits, including a generous pension and insurance package
* Hybrid working model, 2 days per week in the office
* Come and enjoy our beautiful office in central Stockholm (on the 14th floor, with amazing views)



  





**The recruitment process:** 




 We review applications and invite for interviews continuously. A background check will be conducted on final candidates, pre-employment.
 



  





**About Rillion:** 




*We are a global company founded in Sweden with 30 years’ experience in the AP Automation industry. We help finance professionals transform how they manage invoices by digitalizing and automating the entire process.* 




*By removing the manual steps of invoice handling, we enable finance teams to save time and effort, reducing the possibility of human error. Because* 
 we’re AP professionals ourselves, we understand how to give our customers everything they need, and nothing they don’t.
 



*Together with our owners at Altor, we´re on a journey to expand in our home markets, while entering new territories. To complete our mission, we need more talented people!* 




*Rillion is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.*

title: Software Development Engineer in Test
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
   

  

**Who We Need**
 We’re looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to design, build, and scale automated testing solutions that raise the bar for product quality and engineering velocity. You will contribute to end-to-end test automation frameworks, collaborate with developers to improve testability and code quality, and champion best practices that make our platforms more reliable, observable, and easy to change.
   

  

 We are looking for talented, self-motivated individuals with a desire to learn, build deep expertise and create impact working collaboratively. Our associates embrace change, easily integrate and succeed in a fast-paced global environment. If you believe you have what we are looking for, we invite you to be part of our global network of talented, client-focused, forward-thinking teams where your contributions will be recognized and rewarded, helping you to progress your career.
   

  

 You will be part of our Broadridge Trading and Connectivity Solutions (BTCS)' engineering team, creating high performance multi-asset trading platforms that automate the entire front office for investment banks and brokers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop and maintain test automation frameworks - including integration with CI/CD pipelines - using the following automation frameworks/programming languages: Python/Pytest, Groovy, Java, C#
* Build and extend automated test suites covering functional, integration, API and end-to-end testing scenarios
* Collaborate with development teams on code reviews, contributing to code quality
* Contribute to test infrastructure, including test data management and environment provisioning
* Improve quality metrics and communicate potential technical risks to stakeholders across CS, Product and Engineering teams
* Create and maintain technical documentation for automation framework, test strategies and test development processes
* Drive adoption of best practices across the Engineering teams
* Mentor team members on automation techniques, coding standards and testing methodologies
* Participate in architectural discussions and provide an input on testability and quality improvements


**Requirements**
**Mandatory**
* Bachelor’s degree in STEM (Computer Science, Math, Physics or related field) from a recognized institution
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in test automation development and/or software engineering
* Strong programming skills in Python/Pytest
* Experience in designing and developing test automation frameworks
* Experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Bamboo) and automated deployment pipelines
* Proficiency in version control systems (e.g., Git/Gerrit)
* Understanding of software development lifecycle and methodologies
* Bash and command-line proficiency
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to investigate complex technical issues
* Excellent written and spoken English
* Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively in cross-functional teams
* Experience with bug tracking system and test management tools (Jira or similar)


**Beneficial**
* Knowledge of financial markets, financial asset types and exchange connectivity protocols
* Hands-on experience with Docker
* Experience with other programming languages (Groovy, C++, Java, C#)
* Previous experience mentoring junior engineers or/and leading technical initiatives
* Contribution to open-source testing tools or/and frameworks
* Capable of handling multiple projects and context switching effectively


**Hybrid Flexible at Broadridge:**
 We are made up of high-performing teams that meet in person to learn and collaborate as needed. This role is considered hybrid, which means you’ll be assigned to a Broadridge office and given the flexibility to work partially remotely.
   

  

 We are dedicated to fostering a collaborative, engaging, and inclusive environment and are committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates everyone’s unique perspective.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - Node
description:
**At Hemnet, we're in the midst of an exciting transformation — rebalancing our tech stack to better support the future of our products and teams. As part of this journey, we’re starting to expand our tech stack from our existing Ruby-based architecture to modern, scalable services built with Node.js.** 
  

  

 To accelerate this shift and strengthen our capabilities, we’re now investing in growing by hiring additional Node.js developers.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?** 
  

  

* 🧪 Innovative Approach: Work with an experimental and iterative approach. Dare to explore uncharted territories, try something new, and surprise us all!
* 🔄 End-to-End Development: Develop and maintain our products from idea to production
* 🫂 Inclusive Culture: Enjoy a friendly, inclusive, and caring company culture where transparency, work-life balance, and well-being are high priorities. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, or background
* ⚗️ Lab Weeks: Participate in recurring lab weeks—time for our developers to experiment, hack around, and evaluate creative ideas. Unleash Your Inner Mad Scientist—innovation starts here!
* 🛠️ Autonomy: Be part of a team that controls its own product decisions


  

  

**What you will do:** 
  

  

* Contribute to the continuous improvement of existing products and the development of new ones within the product team
* Collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and stakeholders to shape product vision and technical direction
* Participate in discussions and decisions related to architecture, implementation, and prioritization
* Take ownership of code quality, performance, and maintainability through testing, reviews, and refactoring
* Support and maintain production systems, ensuring reliability and stability
* Foster strong cross-functional relationships and actively contribute to a collaborative team culture
* Node.js Journey: Play a central role in our Node.js journey. While we have some services already running in production, this is just the beginning


  

  

**We believe you are:** 
  

  

 We see that you are an experienced developer with documented, commercial experience of working with the Node ecosystem. As our current architecture still includes Ruby components, we think that you are willing to learn and navigate the Ruby code base.
   

  

* Experience from data-driven product development with short iterations and experimentation
* Team Collaboration: Experience working in team settings, especially in medium to large multicultural/global companies
* Extensive experience and proficiency with other programming languages and eco systems. Meritorious frameworks: NestJS, Ruby on Rails, Typescript, React, and Next.js


  

  

**Your technical expertise likely includes several of the following areas:** 
  

  

* JavaScript – Proficiency in ES5, ES6+, and asynchronous programming
* Node.js – In-depth knowledge of Node.js and its ecosystem and frameworks (e.g., NestJS)
* Web Applications – Proven experience in driving architecture and system design, as well as developing and maintaining complex web-based applications in production environments
* RESTful APIs – Experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs
* GraphQL – Familiarity with best practices for implementing and maintaining GraphQL APIs
* Database Management – Proficiency with relational databases such as PostgreSQL
* Cloud Services – Familiarity with AWS, Docker, and CircleCI, including deployment and scaling of Node.js services in cloud environments
* Testing and Debugging – Skilled in testing and debugging Node.js applications to ensure performance and reliabilit


  

  

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Senior System Developer
description:
Join Lumera's dynamic Product Development team in Sweden as we expand our presence in the European Life and Pensions industry. We're seeking an Senior System Developer to help drive our innovative solutions forward as we build tomorrow together.
   

  

 Excited? Submit your open application now!
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Collaborating with agile teams to build and enhance our cutting-edge market leading insurance product.
* Utilizing technologies like Java, SQL, with opportunities to explore new tools.
* Solving tough challenges through design and development in a complex environment.
* Learning, teaching, and executing – together with your team.


 Curious to hear more about life as a system developer at Lumera from Erik Gyllenstierna? Check out this interview!
   

  

**What You’ll Be Getting**
* Amazing colleagues, the best in our field.
* Daily challenges that keep you engaged and motivated.
* Access to in-house business knowledge, just a few desks away.
* Flexible hybrid remote work options, possibility to work remote two days per week.
* A culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing.
* Benefits designed to support a healthy work-life balance.
* Conveniently located offices in Stockholm


**To thrive in this role, you:**
* Hold a Bachelor’s or Master's degree within IT/Computer Science or related fields.
* Bring a couple of years of experience, especially as a Java developer.
* Are proficient in English communication, both spoken and written.
* Have a proactive, solution-oriented mindset.
* Demonstrate drive, curiosity, and a solution-oriented approach.
* Have an ability and preference of working with others.
* Are active in seeking new knowledge from more senior colleagues.
* Value communication, transparency, and openness.
* Enjoy solving problems in a complex environment.
* Need to be able to take advanced business needs, on to solid architectural design and then develop in a complex environment without losing focus on long term maintainability.


 Does this sound like the perfect fit for you? Apply today! Send us your CV or apply using your LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 A background check will be conducted as part of the recruitment process. For any inquiries or general questions, contact Felix Wallin at felix.wallin@lumera.com. We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**About Lumera**
 Lumera is dedicated to the digital transformation of the European Life and Pensions industry. As insurtech innovators, we provide future-proof core technology for policy administration.
   

  

 The Prudent Revolution is our mission – bridging technology and partnership to navigate the fastest, safest path through complex change for L&P providers.
   

  

 We combine tech and industry expertise with relevant market experience to offer a broad range of consultancy and data services – from managing faultless legacy system migration to facilitating compelling end-user experiences.
   

  

 Based in Stockholm, Lumera has significant presence with offices in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, Norway, Sweden, India and Vietnam.
   

  

 Lumera is majority owned by Monterro, a leading Nordic software investor.
   

  

  

  

 www.lumera.com
   

  

 Follow us on LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

 We are Lumera - pioneering the digital transformation of the Life and Pensions industry. With strategic partnerships and advanced automation, we streamline policy administration, making complex processes simpler. Our mission, The Prudent Revolution, guides L&P providers through change, ensuring a smooth transition. Trusted for migrations and armed with deep domain expertise and innovative AI solutions, Lumera shapes the future. Join us on this innovative journey!

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
At MedHelp Care, we’re shaping the future of workplace health management. As a leading Nordic B2B SaaS company, we build intelligent AI-powered platforms that help organizations create healthier, more efficient, and resilient workplaces.
 



  





 Our platform leverages advanced health data analytics and machine learning to detect early signals of health risks, enabling companies to take proactive, preventive action. With predictive insights and a focus on wellbeing, we help organizations care for their people while improving overall performance.
 



  





 We are on an exciting growth journey, expanding our impact and shaping the future of workplace health. We’re now looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer who thrives in a fast-paced product environment, someone who has a strong React background, loves clean UI, and enjoys working closely with product designers and backend engineers to deliver user-facing features that matter.
 



  





**The Role and the Team** 




 Join our innovative and collaborative team dedicated to transforming healthcare through technology. As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you'll be at the forefront of building intuitive and high-performance user interfaces using React and TypeScript. You'll own features end-to-end, from design handoff to deployment, working closely with UX designers and product managers to bring impactful ideas to life.
 



  





**Some of your responsibilities will include:** 



* Designing, implementing, and maintaining high-quality UI components in React and TypeScript.
* Taking full ownership of features, ensuring seamless integration and deployment.
* Collaborating closely with UX designers and product managers to create user-centric solutions.
* Contributing to our design system and frontend architecture.
* Actively participating in code reviews, architecture discussions, and team rituals.



  





 In our team, you'll have the opportunity to work in a supportive environment that encourages continuous learning and growth. Collaborate with talented professionals who are passionate about technology and its potential to make a difference. Contribute to projects that have a meaningful impact on users and the community.
 



  





**About you** 




 To succeed in this role, you are a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment and loves collaborating in a small, skilled engineering team. You’re driven by impact, curious about applying AI and new technologies, and communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 



  





**Technical skills we appreciate:** 



* Strong React developer with solid TypeScript experience
* Experience deploying applications using modern CI/CD pipelines
* Strong understanding of Git and version control workflows
* Deep understanding of state management, component-based design, and frontend performance
* Skilled at integrating REST APIs



  





*In this recruitment, we are collaborating with Safemind, and all applications will be processed through them.*

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
Your role
   

  

 We are at the forefront of an exciting and transformative journey – the development towards smart, sustainable, and connected factories. title: Senior Game Artist
description:
***Do you want to be part of creating fantastic, unique and entertaining iGaming experiences in a competitive global market?***




  





***We are looking for a talented Senior 2D Game Artist - a polishing ninja - with a strong passion for bringing life, entertainment and excitement to our growing games portfolio.***




  





***ELK is a leading developer in the iGaming industry, known for our innovative, visually stunning, and critically acclaimed game titles and IPs. We push the boundaries of gameplay and visual fidelity, setting new standards in the iGaming world.***




  





**About the role:** 




  





 We take great pride in creating and offering our players a wide range of different art styles and themes in our games. As a
 **Senior Game Artist** 
 , you’ll be the driving force in taking game assets from great to extraordinary, pushing them to a level of polish and perfection that elevates the entire player experience. Acting as a creative satellite between two teams and projects, you will see opportunities for improvement, refine workflows, and set the standard for excellence across our games.
 



  





 A typical work week as a Senior Game Artist can consist of:
 



  





**Polishing Assets to Perfection:** 
 Refine and enhance existing game assets, ensuring they reach the highest possible quality. Your expertise in materials such as gold, gemstones, and metallic surfaces will bring depth, realism, and storytelling to every detail.
 



  





**Cross-Team Collaboration:** 
 Work as a satellite between two teams and two projects, identifying opportunities to improve processes, workflows, and the overall artistic impact of each game.
 



  





**Storytelling Through Art:** 
 Use visual storytelling to make assets not only beautiful but also meaningful within the game world, enhancing player immersion and engagement.
 



  





**Hands-On Creation:** 
 While much of your focus will be on polishing, you’ll also create high-quality 2D assets and UI elements when needed, prepared for seamless handover to animators.
 



  





**Raising the Bar:** 
 Help shape and push the boundaries of our visual quality, inspiring other artists while ensuring consistency and alignment with each game’s unique art direction.
 



  





**Communication:** 
 Partner with the Art Director and Creative Director to follow the unique art style of each game. Be open to feedback and take the initiative to independently enhance and perfect your work, while still ensuring it aligns with the creative vision.
 



  





**Innovation:** 
 Push the boundaries of what is possible in the realms of iGames to create visually stunning and memorable experiences.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




  





 We believe you are a passionate, detail-obsessed Game Artist who thrives on making every pixel count. Creative and innovative, you excel at refining work to world-class quality and telling stories through art. With mastery of materials like gold, gems, and metals, you bring realism and depth that elevate the game experience.
 



  





 To thrive with us, you need to be a team player with a good ability to handle feedback and work together with different disciplines. You are self-driven, and responsible and strive to develop your skill and others constantly. It is important that you are organized and solution-oriented with the ability to tackle challenges and solve problems with a strong sense of ownership and deliver on deadlines.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 




  





**Experience:** 
 Minimum of 4+ years creating 2D assets within the iGaming industry, with proven expertise in polishing and refinement.
 



  





**Materials Mastery:** 
 Exceptional ability to render and polish materials such as gold, gemstones, and metallic surfaces with striking realism and artistry.
 



  





**Polishing Expertise:** 
 Skilled at taking assets from “good” to “unforgettable,” ensuring every detail is aligned with the creative vision and ready for production. Skilled at polishing characters is a plus but not required.
 



  





**Software Skills:** 
 Strong knowledge of Photoshop. Knowledge of 3D tools is a plus but not required.
 



  





**Portfolio:** 
 A captivating portfolio showcasing both original asset creation and refined/polished work, with examples of storytelling, material rendering, and diverse art styles.
 



  





**Creativity & Storytelling:** 
 A sharp eye for detail, composition, color, and lighting, with the ability to imbue assets with narrative depth and artistic intent.
 



  





**Passion for Gaming:** 
 A genuine love for games and a deep understanding of what makes them visually engaging and immersive.
 



  





**Language:** 
 Excellent English language skills, both written and spoken. Proficiency in Swedish is a plus but not required.
 



  





**We offer** 




  





 An ever-changing opportunity to explore different art styles, concepts, and themes together with highly skilled creatives in various crafts. Our project cycles are short, and you will be able to thrive in your creativity and passion by creating a range of visually stunning, unforgettable iGaming experiences.
 



  





 We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, where everyone is respected, valued, and empowered to succeed.
 



  





 We work on-site at our awesome office, 2 minutes from T-Centralen in Stockholm.
 



 Fill in an application below and please include your portfolio and CV.
 



 For the right candidate, the recruitment process includes: interviews (digitally and at our studio), as well as a work assignment. We will fill the position as soon as we have found the right candidate, so do not hesitate to submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Senior Dynamics CE Developer
description:
*Are you the developer who thrives on solving complex challenges, fine-tuning every line of code, and pushing Dynamics 365 CE beyond its limits? Join Dustin’s Dynamics team to shape the future of Dynamics 365 in an international setup.*
*We are* 
 looking for someone who lives to code, thrives on technical challenges and loves diving deep into the guts of Dynamics 365, Azure integrations and custom business logic.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Senior Dynamics 365 CE Developer unique**
* A senior role designed for developers who want full ownership of code and innovation.
* Take ownership of designing and delivering innovative technical solutions that drive business transformation.
* A collaborative environment where a "win as a team" attitude prevails, fostering growth and success collectively.


 You will be part of the Dynamics team, with current operations live in BNLX and an exciting project underway in the Nordics. We encourage a welcoming and collaborative environment, with a mix of personalities and an international team, ensuring everyone works together to achieve success.
   

  

*Read more about Dustin here*
**Your role & influence as Senior Dynamics 365 CE Developer**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will play a crucial role in designing, developing and implementing solutions within the Dynamics 365 CE platform to meet the business requirements. This role includes managing releases, coordinating connected ISVs, ensuring code quality, maintaining Dynamics environments, troubleshooting issues, and driving technical excellence.
   

  

*Collaboration* 
 : You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver seamless Dynamics 365 CE solutions and technical releases, ensuring high-quality outcomes.
   

  

 This role requires a strong understanding of Microsoft technologies, CRM development expertise, and the ability to analyse complex business requirements to propose efficient solutions.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Write high-quality, high-performance and maintainable code, and ensuring smooth solution releases.
* Conducting design reviews, troubleshooting, and maintaining environment stability.
* Collaborating to align technical solutions with business requirements in line with industry best practices.


**Benefits of** 
**joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us.
   

  

 You can find more of our Swedish benefits below in the vacancy.
   

  

**This** 
**is what we imagine you bring**
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who combines senior-level expertise in Dynamics 365 CE, .NET, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, Power Platform, and Azure DevOps with excellent communication skills and a passion for collaboration and problem-solving.
   

  

**Additionally, It's Nice That You Have**
* Bachelor's degree level of working and thinking and 5 years’ or more experience of similar job.
* Experience with API integrations, Dual Write, and release pipelines.
* Strong technical skills in Azure services like Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Service Bus.
* Proficiency with SQL Server and related database management tasks.


**What** 
**can you expect next?**
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu.
* First interview with Hiring Manager, Mirjam Stegeman and a colleague.
* Technical (Second) interview with future colleagues from the team.
* A possible final Interview with Director Application Management, Sara Wennerström.
* Professional References.


******Please note that for this specific job, we don´t provide any relocation or work permit sponsorship support.******
**About**
**Read more about how to become a** 
**Dustineer**
 For questions about the position, please contact the Talent Acquisition Partner, Karishma Sindhu via karishma.sindhu@dustin.com.

title: Senior Ruby Developer – Seller Success Team
description:
**At Hemnet, we believe selling your home should be a great experience and as successful as possible. Our Seller Success team is responsible for the services that help sellers maximize their opportunities in the housing market.** 
  

  

 Right now we are looking for a Senior Ruby Developer to complete our team and to take a key role in shaping this journey together with us.
   

  

 👉 Last application day october 8th
   

  

**What You’ll Do** 
  

  

 As a developer in the Seller Success team, you’ll work closely with experienced backend and frontend developers, as well as colleagues from UX, Product, and Analytics to shape our products.
   

  

 Here at Hemnet you will:
   

  

* Contribute to the development of new features and the improvement of existing ones.
* Take part in architectural and technical discussions and decisions.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, and review others’ code.
* Work in pairs or mobs to learn together and improve quality.
* Help plan the team’s work, clarify and prioritize the backlog, and break down goals into actionable steps, most of our teams use Scrum.


  

  

**Who We’re Looking For** 
  

  

 We’re looking for a confident Ruby developer who thrives in a collaborative team environment, someone who enjoys solving real problems and delivering clear value together with our agile development team.
   

  

 You have:
   

  

* Several years of experience as a system developer in a commercial setting.
* Solid hands-on experience with Ruby.
* Knowledge of software design principles, automated testing, and CI/CD.
* Familiarity with PostgreSQL, Docker and cloud infrastructure (we’re on AWS).
* You understand the importance of time-to-market, performance, code quality and team collaboration.
* You prefer working in iterative development cycles and incremental deployments.
* You’re used to working in agile, cross-functional teams.


  

  

 It’s a plus if you already have:
   

  

* Experience with Node.js.
* Knowledge of GraphQL, experience building or using APIs in that format.
* Interest in AI-powered developer tools (e.g. ChatGPT, GitHub Copilot, Claude Code).


  

  

**Who You Are** 
  

  

 We value curiosity, creativity, and a collaborative mindset. You’re comfortable sharing ideas, supporting colleagues, and driving initiatives forward together. You enjoy contributing to both the technical and cultural strength of your team.
   

  

**I am your new manager 👋** 
  

  

 My name is Johan Boberg, I joined Hemnet in June, prior to Hemnet I worked at Blocket for many years. I have a long career behind me as Engineering Manager and before that, as Backend Developer.
   

  

 As a manager, I am supportive and humble, my goal is to create an environment where you can feel trusted, be challenged and empowered to grow. My job is to lead the team to a productive and creative space where everyone can contribute.
   

  

**A Note on Inclusion 💚** 
  

  

 At Hemnet, we believe that diversity in gender, sexual orientation, ability, neurodiversity, cultural background and life experience makes us stronger. We welcome applicants of all identities and backgrounds.
   

  

 If you meet many but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to apply. We value curiosity, a strong sense of purpose and the motivation to learn and grow, alongside your skills and experiences.
   

  

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Senior Pega Developer
description:
**Arbetsförmedlingen, IT-avdelningen, Enheten Digitalt kundflöde** 




  





*Vill du vara med och utveckla lösningar som varje år gör skillnad för arbetssökande, arbetsförmedlare och samarbetspartners? Hos oss får du arbeta med modern teknik, kompetenta kollegor och en produkt som är central för Sveriges arbetsmarknad. Tillsammans får vi Sverige i arbete! Vill du bli en av oss?* 




  





**Vilka är vi** 




  





 Sektionen Bedömning och Handlingsplan utvecklar produkten Planering av stöd.
 



  





 Planering av stöd används för bedömning och upprättande av handlingsplan för arbetssökande. Produkten är central för informationsutbytet mellan arbetssökande, arbetsförmedlingen och fristående aktörer. Vi utvecklar automatiseringar och datadrivna lösningar och hanterar runt 2 miljoner ärenden per år.
 



  





 Produkten byggs på modulär arkitektur. Vi utvecklar och underhåller lösningar med olika tekniker såsom Rest-API:er, JMS-lyssnare, Job-schedulers, Queue-processors och Constellation.
 



  





 Vi är ett team som värderar samarbete och öppenhet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utveckla din tekniska förmåga och vi uppmuntrar alla medarbetare att gå kurser och ta del av kompetensutveckling.
 



  





**Vem söker vi** 




  





 Som Pega-utvecklare tar du ett stort ansvar för både din egen prestation och teamets leveranser. Du har en god kommunikativ förmåga, samarbetar väl och bygger starka relationer. Du drivs av att ständigt utveckla både dig själv och kvaliteten i dina leveranser.
 



  





 Du har god överblick över mål och plan framåt för det arbete du och ditt team driver, och du kommunicerar på ett enkelt och begripligt sätt vad som är gjort, vad som återstår samt vilka hinder eller risker som finns för att nå målen.
 



  





 Du har förmåga att förmedla kunskap och information på ett pedagogiskt sätt och bidrar med ett coachande förhållningssätt gentemot mer juniora kollegor.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




  





 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse. Placeringsort är Arbetsförmedlingens huvudkontor i Solna.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder förmånliga semesteravtal, friskvård på arbetstid samt friskvårdsbidrag. I denna tjänst erbjuder vi möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 49 procent på årsbasis.
 



  





 Jag som rekryterar heter Anders och är en nyfiken, friluftsälskande före detta norrlänning. En av anledningarna till att jag arbetar på Arbetsförmedlingen är att vi hjälper företag och människor att växa. Mejla mig gärna så kan vi prata mer.
 



  






 Mer om att jobba hos oss
 




  





**Grundläggande kvalifikationskrav** 




  




* Systemvetenskaplig utbildning, alternativt motsvarande kunskaper förvärvade på annat sätt och som bedöms som likvärdiga
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet som SSA
* Är PCSSA-certifierad (eller högre)
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att bygga säkra API:er och säkra system
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet av relationsdatabaser och kunskap inom SQL
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta enligt Pega best practices, exempelvis med komponentarkitektur för återanvändning och skalbarhet
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga i svenska eller engelska, i både tal och skrift



  





**Övriga meriter** 




  




* Erfarenhet av arbete på Arbetsförmedlingen med utveckling av system som stödjer arbetsförmedlare, arbetssökande eller fristående aktörer
* Kunskap om Pega Constellation
* Certifiering i SAFe eller Scrum
* Kunskap om ActiveMQ
* Kunskap om Kibana



  





 Den statliga värdegrunden guidar oss i vårt dagliga arbete. Som anställd hos oss förväntas du arbeta rättvist, opartiskt och med hög integritet, samt bidra till att upprätthålla och stärka förtroendet för vår myndighet.
 



  






 Mer om statliga värdegrunden
