title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
description:
About us:
   

  

 Legora is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $37M in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Legora is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

**The role:**
 As a Fullstack Engineer at Legora you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

* Architect and implement features end-to-end for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as Python, React, Node.js, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Review code and mentor junior colleagues to support them in their development, making the team even better!
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are:
   

  

* A passionate engineer with several years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Legora for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Software Developer – High Performance Computing
description:
We are looking for a skilled software developer to join our team dedicated to creating advanced algorithms in the field of High Performance Computing. The majority of our development work is done in C++, with some use of Java.COMSOL develops cutting-edge mathematical modeling software that powers innovations in physics and engineering. Our flagship product, COMSOL Multiphysics®, is widely used across all fields of engineering, manufacturing, and scientific research to model multiphysics systems. Our customers leverage our software to understand, predict, and optimize product designs and processes. Founded in Sweden in 1986, COMSOL has expanded globally with 16 offices and a distributor network, employing more than 500 people worldwide.Based in our newly renovated office in central Stockholm, the team is responsible for developing the High Performance Computing (HPC) part in all COMSOL’s products that take advantage of distributed memory on clusters, shared memory on multi-core and multiple CPU machines and the support for GPUs. Our goal is to enable efficient finite-element (FEM) computations on large scale applications.You will work with advanced algorithms for solving linear and non-linear equations. Responsibilities include writing and reviewing code, contributing to project specifications and design, and testing new functionality.We are looking for developers with the following qualifications:
   

  

* PhD, MSc or equivalent degree in scientific computing.
* Experience in writing efficient algorithms using CUDA for GPUs and MPI for High Performance Computing.
* Experience in OpenMP is a plus.
* You must be eligible to work in Sweden, but Swedish is not a requirement as long as you have excellent English skills.


 At COMSOL, new team members quickly become essential contributors to ongoing development projects. As the company continues to expand, there are plenty of opportunities for employees to advance in their roles and become leading experts in their areas of focus. This journey will be accompanied by experienced colleagues and a collaborative working environment.In addition to an exciting career working on a sophisticated software product, we offer:
   

  

* A competitive salary
* Individual pension plans
* Sponsored gym membership
* Great work-life balance


 To ensure a smooth onboarding process, onsite presence is required. Once onboarded, hybrid work options are available.Does this sound interesting? Submit your application, including university grades, using the form below. Kindly note that applications submitted through other channels will not be considered.We review applications continuously.

title: Software Development Engineer in Test
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
   

  

**Who We Need**
 We’re looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to design, build, and scale automated testing solutions that raise the bar for product quality and engineering velocity. You will contribute to end-to-end test automation frameworks, collaborate with developers to improve testability and code quality, and champion best practices that make our platforms more reliable, observable, and easy to change.
   

  

 We are looking for talented, self-motivated individuals with a desire to learn, build deep expertise and create impact working collaboratively. Our associates embrace change, easily integrate and succeed in a fast-paced global environment. If you believe you have what we are looking for, we invite you to be part of our global network of talented, client-focused, forward-thinking teams where your contributions will be recognized and rewarded, helping you to progress your career.
   

  

 You will be part of our Broadridge Trading and Connectivity Solutions (BTCS)' engineering team, creating high performance multi-asset trading platforms that automate the entire front office for investment banks and brokers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop and maintain test automation frameworks - including integration with CI/CD pipelines - using the following automation frameworks/programming languages: Python/Pytest, Groovy, Java, C#
* Build and extend automated test suites covering functional, integration, API and end-to-end testing scenarios
* Collaborate with development teams on code reviews, contributing to code quality
* Contribute to test infrastructure, including test data management and environment provisioning
* Improve quality metrics and communicate potential technical risks to stakeholders across CS, Product and Engineering teams
* Create and maintain technical documentation for automation framework, test strategies and test development processes
* Drive adoption of best practices across the Engineering teams
* Mentor team members on automation techniques, coding standards and testing methodologies
* Participate in architectural discussions and provide an input on testability and quality improvements


**Requirements**
**Mandatory**
* Bachelor’s degree in STEM (Computer Science, Math, Physics or related field) from a recognized institution
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in test automation development and/or software engineering
* Strong programming skills in Python/Pytest
* Experience in designing and developing test automation frameworks
* Experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Bamboo) and automated deployment pipelines
* Proficiency in version control systems (e.g., Git/Gerrit)
* Understanding of software development lifecycle and methodologies
* Bash and command-line proficiency
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to investigate complex technical issues
* Excellent written and spoken English
* Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively in cross-functional teams
* Experience with bug tracking system and test management tools (Jira or similar)


**Beneficial**
* Knowledge of financial markets, financial asset types and exchange connectivity protocols
* Hands-on experience with Docker
* Experience with other programming languages (Groovy, C++, Java, C#)
* Previous experience mentoring junior engineers or/and leading technical initiatives
* Contribution to open-source testing tools or/and frameworks
* Capable of handling multiple projects and context switching effectively


**Hybrid Flexible at Broadridge:**
 We are made up of high-performing teams that meet in person to learn and collaborate as needed. This role is considered hybrid, which means you’ll be assigned to a Broadridge office and given the flexibility to work partially remotely.
   

  

 We are dedicated to fostering a collaborative, engaging, and inclusive environment and are committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates everyone’s unique perspective.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Passionate about cutting-edge technology and making the world more sustainable at the same time?** 
 Join us at Worldfavor, where our mission is to make 
 **sustainable business mainstream** 
 . 🌱
 



  





 We are a leading global SaaS platform where users can easily share, access, and gain insights into corporate sustainability data. Having expanded rapidly, Worldfavor now connects over 30,000 businesses across 140 countries. We work with a range of renowned clients, from Nordic leaders to global Fortune 500 companies. We're on an exhilarating growth journey to become the market leader and expand our global reach.
 



  





 At Worldfavor, you'll be part of a 
 **diverse and dynamic team** 
  of intelligent, fun-loving, and ambitious individuals who share a common 
 **passion** 
  for leveraging technology to foster a sustainable world. We value sustainable living and working, and we celebrate both significant and minor milestones. Our team ethos always prioritizes collective achievements over individual victories.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Fullstack engineer (with a frontend focus), you are at the heart of our engineering process. You’ll develop high-quality, scalable, and predictive software solutions primary with React but also work with .NET/C# in the backend.
 



  





 You will be responsible for:
 


* Designing, developing, and maintaining robust software that meets client sustainability needs.
* Collaborating cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Customer Support teams to enhance product features and improve user experience.
* Driving innovation and efficiency through continuous integration, continuous deployment, and automated testing.
* Troubleshooting, debugging, and upgrading existing software.



  





**Who Are You?** 




 We are seeking a proactive, tech-savvy individual with:
 


* **3+ years of professional experience** 
  building production-grade software, primarily with 
 **React** 
  or similar frontend technologies.
* Knowledge of C# or similar languages (such as Kotlin or Java) and relational databases.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of architecting high-performance systems.
* Fluency in English; Swedish is a plus.



  





 Ideally, you are an innovative person who enjoys experimenting with new technologies. You work well with others and inspire those around you through your expertise. You are able to communicate complex ideas in a clear way to non-technical stakeholders, and you thrive in a fast-paced and ever-evolving environment.
 



  





 Like all team members at Worldfavor, we expect you to be ambitious, humble, have a "can-do attitude", take ownership, and be driven by the desire to shape a more sustainable world.
 



  





 We recruit, work, and promote based on 
 **our core values** 
 :
 


* We make an 
 **impact.**
* We take 
 **ownership.**
* We always 
 **evolve.**
* We’re in it 
 **together.**
* We believe anything is 
 **possible.**



  





 At Worldfavor, you’ll be part of an exciting scale-up journey with ambitious global plans, giving you exceptional opportunities to grow your career as we expand. Our vibrant Impact House in the heart of Stockholm offers an inspiring place to work together and make an impact. We value wellbeing and balance, which is why we provide six weeks of paid vacation plus five additional paid days off, along with a competitive pension and generous health benefits. To encourage continuous growth, we also offer a personal development contribution that allows you to pursue learning in the areas that inspire you most.
 



  





**Sounds Like a Match?** 




 Apply on our career site: https://worldfavor.careers.haileyhr.app. We are excited to learn what drives you!
 



  





*We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process to ensure a safe and trusted working environment.*

title: Engineer, Field Applications, Early Career Program-1
description:
Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare.
   

  

 ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future.
   

  

****About Analog Devices****
 Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI ) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $9 billion in FY24 and approximately 24,000 people globally, ADI ensures today's innovators stay Ahead of What's Possible™. Learn more at www.analog.com and on LinkedIn and Twitter (X).
   

  

 Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare.
   

  

 ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future.
   

  

**About Analog Devices**
 Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI ) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $9 billion in FY24 and approximately 24,000 people globally, ADI ensures today's innovators stay Ahead of What's Possible™. Learn more at www.analog.com and on LinkedIn and Twitter (X).
   

  

  

  

 Are you an engineer who enjoys working with others to solve challenging problems? Who likes working with customers and their engineering teams?  Would you like to work with an industry-leading, growing company that offers cutting edge technology?  If so, then Analog Devices’ Early Career Program is a great fit for you!
   

  

  

  

 In this program, you’ll be working with engineers both internally to Analog Devices and externally at customer accounts, along with mentors in Sales Engineer and Applications Engineer roles, to solve some of the most complex engineering problems facing customers today.
   

  

 You’ll learn through a structured development program that includes technical training, projects, job shadowing and coaching. The Early Career Program prepares you to excel in Analog Device’s Sales organization, as a Field Applications Engineer.
   

  

  

  

 Skills you will develop include, but are not limited to:
   

  

* Educating customers on Analog Devices' solutions and products
* Developing and maintaining professional business relationships with customers
* Understanding and disseminating customers' system needs verses wants
* Proposing system solutions to customers
* Assist in the definition, design and development of new products and tools
* Developing new accounts and/or expanding existing customer accounts
* Best practices for customer support to resolve customer issues or difficulties


 Qualifications and required skills include:
   

  

* Electronic Engineering degree
* Up to two-year work experience
* Strong communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
* Team and customer oriented; strong ability to collaborate and work with others
* Strong problem solving and logical thinking skills
* Good lab measurement and debug skills
* Ability to operate with:
* An Ahead of What’s Possible mindset,
* High energy,
* Entrepreneurial thinking and hands-on approach
* Able to demonstrate leadership characteristics
* Ability to travel 25-40% of time
* Driving license


  

  

 Other Desired Interests:
   

  

* Electronics engineer, Telecommunication, RF or similar related degree
* Able to relocate and have a right-to-work in Europe


*For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.*
*Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture where everyone has an opportunity to succeed regardless of their race, color, religion, age, ancestry, national origin, social or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, union membership, and political affiliation, or any other legally protected group.*
 Job Req Type: Graduate Job
   

  

 Required Travel: Yes, 10% of the time

title: Test Trainee
description:
Are you passionate about embedded systems and test automation? We're looking for a driven Embedded Software Test Engineer Trainee to join our team and help us ensure the reliability and performance of our embedded solutions.
   

  

 If you have a solid foundation in Python and pytest, and you're curious about LabVIEW, this is your chance to grow in a dynamic and supportive environment.
   

  

**What You’ll Do, As part of our test engineering team, you will:**
 Develop and maintain automated test scripts using Python and pytest.
   

  

 Execute functional, regression, and integration tests on embedded software.
   

  

 Collaborate with hardware and software engineers to define test strategies and improve coverage.
   

  

 Learn and apply LabVIEW for hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) and instrumentation testing.
   

  

 Analyze test results, identify issues, and contribute to continuous improvement.
   

  

 Document test procedures and results in a clear and structured manner.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For:**
 Has a background in Embedded Systems, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
   

  

 Is proficient in Python and familiar with test frameworks like pytest.
   

  

 Understands embedded software development and testing principles.
   

  

 Is open to learning LabVIEW and working with hardware interfaces.
   

  

 Has strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
   

  

 Communicates effectively and works well in a team.
   

  

**What You’ll Gain:**
 Hands-on experience in embedded software testing and automation.
   

  

 Exposure to LabVIEW and hardware testing environments.
   

  

 Mentorship from experienced engineers.
   

  

 Opportunities to contribute to real-world projects.
   

  

 Potential for long-term career growth within the company.
   

  

**We are looking for a candidate who can start as soon as possible.
   

  

 The position is set to end in September 2026, with the possibility of extension into a full-time role.**
**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Staff Software Engineer - Connectivity
description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  





 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 Tink, delivering Open Open Banking Solutions as a part of Visa, is building an open banking platform that enables banks, fintechs and startups to develop data-driven financial services. Through one API, Tink allows customers to access aggregated financial data, initiate payments, enrich transactions and build personal finance management tools. Tink connects to more than 3,400 banks that reach over 250 million bank customers across Europe and other global markets. Our solutions are ready-to-go products, each developed to solve specific problems and bring value to both businesses and their customers.
   

  





 We are looking for a Staff Software Engineer to join our Connectivity markets area. Connectivity teams develop software agents integrating data from 3400+ financial institutions. They ultimately focus on continual service improvements and enable real-time transactions and payment processing in the EU and other global markets and provide seamless authentication flows.
   

  





 You’ll be responsible for developing integrations with financial institutes helping consumers to aggregate their financial data from all of their banks and credit cards. It means integrating with both documented and undocumented APIs, developing smart and effective tools to help us automate integrations, monitoring and alerting.
   

  





 What you will do:
   

  




* Work with high load systems with high uptime requirements, including on-call shifts.
* Lead the end-to-end design and architecture of a new systems, ensuring it meets the highest standards of scalability, reliability, and performance
* Work with Tink’s technologies which is mainly Java, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, SQL, Datadog and much more.
* Build components that integrate with banks’ APIs and fetch consumers’ data.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to a team of engineers, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence



 This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.
   

  

  

  




**Qualifications**

 We are looking for a Staff Software Engineer with experience of building innovative and scalable products. You understand the trade-offs of speed vs quality on technical decisions and look at problems from different angles. You also invest time in your own, and the team's development to build up your overall knowledge.
   

  





 We would like you to have:
   

  




* Extensive experience leading technical strategy and architecture for new systems and enhancing and modernizing legacy systems
* Proven experience as a strong Senior/Staff engineer, leading technical teams in fintech and fullstack/backend systems.
* Experience working with JAVA, kubernetes, AWS, devOps methodologies and tooling
* Experience with a fast-paced environment that is product centric
* Experience working with agile methodologies and understand the value of tracking engineering key metrics
* Experience from duties including operational excellence and on-call is a bonus.
* Strong understanding of both backend and frontend systems in Open Banking will be a bonus.


**Additional Information**

**​​​​​​** 
 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: AI Engineer - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
As of 2 September 2025, Tietoevry Tech Services, earlier part of Tietoevry Group, will operate as a standalone company. We'll soon be operating under a new name:
 **Vivicta** 
 . You will discover more about our new brand by the end of the year. Read more.
   

  

 You may apply by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 Har du passion för artificiell intelligens och vill vara med och forma framtidens lösningar inom GenAI och/eller Machine Learning? Har du erfarenhet av att utveckla AI-lösningar och driva implementationer i projekt och Proof of Concepts (PoC)? Då kan du vara den vi söker till rollen som AI Engineer hos Tietoevry Tech Services. Vi driver transformationer inom kundernas affärsprocesser, applikationer och infrastruktur på den nordiska marknaden med hjälp av AI.
   

  

**I rollen som AI Engineer hos Tietoevry Tech Services kommer du att**
* Utveckla och implementera AI-lösningar projekt och PoC
* Arbeta nära våra kunder och tekniska experter för att förstå krav och omsätta dem till tekniska lösningar
* Bygga och optimera AI-modeller och pipelines för olika användningsområden
* Utforska och utvärdera nya teknologier och verktyg inom AI och GenAI
* Bidra till teknisk dokumentation och kunskapsdelning inom globala teamet
* Säkerställa kvalitet, prestanda och säkerhet i AI-lösningar
* Delta i leveranser och ta ansvar för tekniska delar i projekt och PoC


**Vi söker dig som har**
* Flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med AI-utveckling, gärna med fokus på GenAI
* Gedigen kunskap inom Python, Machine Learning-ramverk och GenAI-verktyg
* Erfarenhet av plattformar i molnet (t ex Azure, AWS, GCP) och/eller on-prem
* Förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett tydligt sätt till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter
* Erfarenhet av hybridleveranser och samarbete med near-/offshore-team är meriterande
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, en öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder dig även en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en växande, snabbt utvecklande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del av att möjliggöra din framgång. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt arbetssätt. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och lärande som en livsstil där du behöver utmana dig själv och lära dig nya färdigheter varje dag när nya möjligheter uppstår.
   

  

**Låter det inspirerande?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan. Vänligen bifoga ditt CV eller din LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmuntrar dig att ansöka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta rekryteringschef Mikael Johansson, mikael.v.johansson@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Vi hoppas att höra från dig snart.
   

  

 Tjänstens placering: Sverige
   

  

*Vi utför bakgrundskontroller på alla slutkandidater.*
*Tietoevry Tech Services avvisar samtal från rekryteringsföretag.*
**Om Tietoevry Tech Services**
 Tietoevry Tech Services är en ledande leverantör av transformations- och IT-drifttjänster, med fokus på nordiska privata och offentliga kunder inom olika branscher.
   

  

 Med vårt kompletta utbud av digitala lösningar – inklusive applikationer, multicloud, data & AI samt säkerhetstjänster – hjälper vi företag att utvecklas och håller de nordiska samhällena i gång. Vi är ett globalt team med över 7 000 experter från mer än 50 nationaliteter och levererar tjänster till våra kunder genom att kombinera globala kapabiliteter med nordisk närhet. Ledd av våra värderingar – jämlikhet, transparens och tillit – strävar vi efter att vara den bästa möjliga arbetsplatsen.
   

  

 Nu söker vi talangfulla personer som vill följa med oss på vår spännande resa mot att bli ett självständigt bolag och tillsammans forma det digitala landskapet i Norden.

title: DevOps/Cloud Engineer
description:
**Om oss** 

 Delorean är en snabbväxande digital byrå som hjälper företag och organisationer att utveckla innovativa strategier, digitala tjänster och kreativa kommunikationslösningar. Vi är stolt vinnare av Årets Digitala Byrå 2024 och har ett härligt gäng medarbetare som brinner för att skapa digital framgång. Nu söker vi en driven och
 **erfaren DevOps/Cloud Engineer** 
 som vill vara en del av vår resa och bygga skalbara, effektiva och automatiserade leveransflöden för framtidens digitala upplevelser.
 



  




**Om tjänsten** 

 Brinner du för att bygga bryggor mellan utveckling och drift, och säkerställa att mjukvara levereras snabbt, säkert och smidigt? Som DevOps/Cloud Engineer på Delorean spelar du en central roll i att automatisera våra leveransprocesser, hantera molninfrastruktur och optimera systemens prestanda och skalbarhet. Du kommer att arbeta nära utvecklare, projektledare och kunder för att skapa robusta CI/CD-pipelines och molnmiljöer som driver våra innovativa webb- och app-projekt.
 



 Din vardag kommer att innebära att designa och implementera lösningar för automatisering, deployment, monitorering och säkerhet på olika molnplattformar. Vi söker dig som älskar att optimera, effektivisera och arbeta i gränslandet mellan kod och infrastruktur, med en stark vilja att utforska och implementera de bästa lösningarna, oavsett molnleverantör.
 



  




**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:** 
* CI/CD-pipelines: Designa, hantera och optimera CI/CD-pipelines för webbapplikationer (frontend, API:er, microservices) med verktyg som GitHub Actions, Azure Pipelines (YAML) och/eller andra moderna CI/CD-system.
* Molninfrastruktur som kod (IaC): Utveckla och underhålla skalbar molninfrastruktur på plattformar som Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP) och/eller AWS. Du kommer att arbeta med IaC-verktyg som exempelvis Terraform.
* Plattformshantering: Hantera specifika tjänster och verktyg som Azure DevOps (Boards, Repos, Pipelines, Test Plans, Artifacts), inklusive implementering av bästa praxis för Git.
* Automatisering: Automatisera bygg-, driftsättnings-, test- och infrastrukturuppgifter med skriptspråk som PowerShell, Bash eller Python.
* Monitorering & Drift: Implementera och hantera monitorering och larm med verktyg som Azure Monitor/Application Insights eller motsvarande från andra molnleverantörer, samt felsöka prestandaproblem i produktionsmiljöer.
* Säkerhet (DevSecOps): Integrera säkerhetsrutiner och bästa praxis (DevSecOps) i leveransflödena, inklusive SAST/DAST-scanning och hantering av hemligheter (t.ex. Azure Key Vault eller liknande).
* Samarbete: Arbeta tätt med utvecklings-, QA- och driftteam för att guida DevOps-praxis och säkerställa smidiga releaser.
* Optimering: Kontinuerligt förbättra driftsättningsstrategier, verktyg, kostnadseffektivitet, prestanda och tillförlitlighet.
* Dokumentation: Upprätthålla tydlig och aktuell dokumentation för pipelines, infrastruktur och processer.



  




**Vi söker dig som:** 
* Har 3-5+ års erfarenhet som DevOps Engineer eller liknande roll, med fokus på molnleveranser av webbapplikationer.
* Har djup erfarenhet av att hantera CI/CD-pipelines för webbapplikationer (.NET, Node.js, Python, Java, SPAs).
* Har stark kompetens inom Infrastructure as Code (IaC) med Terraform, ARM-mallar och/eller Bicep.
* Har gedigen erfarenhet av minst en större molnplattform, såsom Azure, men gärna även kännedom om Google Cloud Platform (GCP) och/eller AWS.
* Har kunskap om Azure DevOps-sviten (Pipelines, Repos, Artifacts).
* Har starka skriptkunskaper i t.ex. PowerShell, Bash eller Python.
* Har expertis inom Git versionshantering och branchstrategier.
* Har god förståelse för webbarkitektur, nätverk och molnsäkerhet.
* Har erfarenhet av monitorering, loggning och larmsystem.
* Har utmärkt problemlösningsförmåga och samarbetsförmåga.



  




**Meriterande kompetenser (inte ett krav, men ett stort plus):** 
* Certifieringar inom molnplattformar (t.ex. AZ-400, AZ-104, AZ-204, Google Cloud Engineer-certifieringar, AWS-certifieringar).
* Erfarenhet av GitHub Actions.
* Erfarenhet av Docker och Kubernetes/AKS.
* Familiaritet med databasdriftsättningsstrategier.
* Erfarenhet av att implementera DevSecOps-verktyg och praxis.
* Erfarenhet av Agile/Scrum-metodologier.



  




**Vi erbjuder:** 
* En dynamisk och kreativ arbetsmiljö där du får utrymme att växa och utvecklas.
* Spännande och varierande projekt där du får bygga grunden för framtidens digitala lösningar och automationsprocesser.
* Ett passionerat team som värdesätter innovation, samarbete och hög kvalitet.
* Möjligheten att påverka tekniska arkitekturer och bidra till prisbelönta lösningar.
* Kollektivavtal, pension, friskvårdsbidrag och andra förmåner.



  




**Ansökan:** 

 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra till digital framgång med oss? Skicka ditt CV och ett personligt brev där du berättar varför just du är rätt person för rollen som DevOps/Cloud Engineer hos oss.
 



 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Solution Architect to Swedbank Försäkring
company_industry: Banking, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
Are you an IT architect or a Senior Software Engineer heading for new challenges? Passionate about Java & state-of-the-art technologies that drives Architectural transformation across the bank, more focused on Insurance/Pensions domain? Then you might be the person we are looking for.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* To be part of driving and developing our future Insurance business
* Contribute to our great transformation journey to a new container-based platform
* Work close to other architects/senior software engineers within and outside our Value Stream
* Support and lead our development teams in technical related issues and decisions
* Specify and analyze business, technology and infrastructure requirements and architecture design
* Take responsibility for creating IT solutions that fulfil business requirements while following architectural guidelines
* Interact closely with business architects as well as our stakeholders from different areas


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* As a Solution/Technical Architect, you will play a valuable role in driving the creation of the IT architecture, that is needed to support and direct several development initiatives as per groups roadmap
* Providing detailed solution design and architectural inputs, that includes business, application, data, process and technology architecture viewpoints, benefits/drawback of various alternatives and artefacts such as High-Level Design (HLD)
* Previous working experience with Java, REST APIs, SOAP/WebServices, Microservices.
* Previous working experience with Databases, RedHat, Angular, Design & integration patterns, Azure/AWS cloud is beneficial
* Understanding of agile processes (Scrum and SAFe)
* Motivation to seek for simple solutions to complex problems and the ability to communicate it in an understandable way
* Previous experience from working within an Enterprise environment in a large organisation is beneficial
* Great communication skills and a team player who enjoys sharing knowledge and learning from other colleagues
* A problem solver who gets motivated by new responsibilities and have experience from coordinating IT activities
* Fluent in English, written and spoken (skills in Swedish language is seen as a plus)
* A positive mindset and a can-do-attitude
* A big plus for experience from the pension and insurance field


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

* become part of a skilled group of people where we strive to have a good work climate and an inclusive atmosphere. Contribute with your commitment and passion for IT architecture and software development to create value and quality services for our


 stakeholders and customers. Be part of a growing business and contribute to us getting better and better by constantly improving the way of working in both our teams and together with others. We are strongly contributing to and involved in the execution of the entire bank's Savings Strategy where a lot of activities are happening and will continue to do in the coming years.
   

  

 Swedbank Försäkring is a fully owned subsidiary of Swedbank and an important part of Swedbank's savings strategy and with assets over 300 billion SEK makes us a major insurance partner in Sweden. Our value stream "Release & Delivery Management" is an important part of the company and by working with us you get the best of being part of both a small company and at the same time a large group. Swedbank Försäkring has approximately 200 employees and Johanna Okasmaa-Nilsson is the CEO."
 **Marcus Törenholt your future leader**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 10.10.2025. We work with continuous selection, which means that the position may be filled before the application deadline.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sundbyberg
   

  

**Recruiting manager:** 
 Marcus Törenholt
   

  

 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**Senior Data Engineer - Saint-Gobain Nordic & Baltic – Stockholm eller Köpenhamn** 




  





**Bakgrund** 




 Saint-Gobain är en världsledande aktör inom hållbara bygglösningar och byggmaterial. Med ett starkt fokus på innovation, energieffektivitet och miljöansvar utvecklar vi högpresterande lösningar som förbättrar livskvaliteten och bidrar till en mer hållbar framtid.
 



  





 På Saint-Gobain Construction Materials Nordic & Baltic bygger vi en modern, molnbaserad dataplattform för att stödja datadrivet beslutsfattande över sju länder och tre varumärken.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som vill vara med och forma vår arkitektur, våra datapipelines och hur data används i hela organisationen. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av skalbara, högkvalitativa datalösningar som driver analys och beslutsfattande inom områden som försäljning, supply chain, ekonomi och drift och blir en viktig del av vår resa från fragmenterad till enhetlig data i en högpresterande plattform baserad på Snowflake.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden** 



* Bygga och underhålla robusta datapipelines för vår Snowflake Data Cloud
* Designa och implementera skalbara och säkra datamodeller
* Arbeta nära verksamheten för att förstå databehov och översätta dessa till tekniska lösningar
* Optimera och automatisera datatransformation med moderna DevOps-arbetsflöden (Azure DevOps, Git, VS Code)
* Samarbeta med globala och lokala team för att säkerställa datastyrning, versionshantering och kvalitet
* Bidra till utformningen av vår molnbaserade dataarkitektur och utvecklingen av vår moderna dataplattform
* Stödja migreringen från äldre SQL Server-miljöer till Snowflake



  





**Din bakgrund** 



* Vi tror att du är en problemlösare som trivs med att omvandla komplexa datautmaningar till eleganta ingenjörslösningar. För att lyckas i rollen har du troligen:
* 5+ års erfarenhet av data engineering eller backend-datautveckling
* Praktisk erfarenhet av SQL och molnbaserade datalager (Snowflake är ett plus)
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Python och/eller Java för databehandling
* Kännedom om DevOps-verktyg såsom Azure DevOps, Git och Visual Studio Code
* Erfarenhet av datastyrning och versionshantering
* Förståelse för affärssystem (ERP, CRM, PIM etc.) – SAP-kunskaper är ett plus
* Erfarenhet från BI-miljöer (Power BI, QlikView/Sense)
* En relevant akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, informationssystem, teknik eller liknande
* Flytande engelska & kunskaper i ett nordiskt språk



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 



* En nyckelroll i ett dynamiskt, samarbetsinriktat och innovativt företag som värderar sina medarbetare högt
* Möjlighet att arbeta med banbrytande teknik som bidrar till framgången för branschledande, mer miljövänliga produkter
* Kontinuerlig professionell utveckling och karriärmöjligheter
* Bra förmåner



  





**Ansökan & information** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med
 **Aliby – The Pink Company** 
 . Eftersom intervjuer och urval sker löpande, skicka gärna din ansökan så snart som möjligt. För frågor, kontakta rekryteringskonsult
 **Omar Burazerovic** 
 på +46 728–897441 eller omar.burazerovic@aliby.se.
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan – tack!
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Saint-Gobain – Making the world a better home!
 



 Vår vision är att bli världsledande inom hållbart byggande. Saint-Gobain designar, producerar och distribuerar material och tjänster för bostads- och industrimarknaderna. Dessa lösningar finns överallt i vår vardag: byggnader, transporter, infrastruktur och i många industriella tillämpningar. De bidrar med komfort, prestanda och hållbarhet samtidigt som de möter utmaningarna inom avkarbonisering, resursbevarande och snabb urbanisering.
 



 Saint-Gobain är en nyckelspelare i kampen mot klimatförändringarna med målet att maximera den positiva påverkan för våra kunder och minimera vårt eget miljöavtryck. Med närvaro i
 **76 länder** 
 , över
 **160 000 anställda** 
 och en omsättning på
 **47,9 miljarder euro** 
 , står hållbara lösningar för
 **72 % av koncernens omsättning** 
 .
 



  





 I Norden och Baltikum är Saint-Gobain verksamt i sju länder med över 20 välkända varumärken och mer än 10 000 anställda. Här främjar vi en kultur av tillit, samarbete och ansvar som uppmuntrar öppen kommunikation och beslutsfattande på alla nivåer. Vår entreprenöriella anda driver innovation och tillväxt, och vår flexibilitet gör att vi snabbt kan anpassa oss till marknadens förändringar och möta kundernas behov.

title: Senior Ruby Developer – Seller Success Team
description:
**At Hemnet, we believe selling your home should be a great experience and as successful as possible. Our Seller Success team is responsible for the services that help sellers maximize their opportunities in the housing market.** 
  

  

 Right now we are looking for a Senior Ruby Developer to complete our team and to take a key role in shaping this journey together with us.
   

  

 👉 Last application day october 8th
   

  

**What You’ll Do** 
  

  

 As a developer in the Seller Success team, you’ll work closely with experienced backend and frontend developers, as well as colleagues from UX, Product, and Analytics to shape our products.
   

  

 Here at Hemnet you will:
   

  

* Contribute to the development of new features and the improvement of existing ones.
* Take part in architectural and technical discussions and decisions.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, and review others’ code.
* Work in pairs or mobs to learn together and improve quality.
* Help plan the team’s work, clarify and prioritize the backlog, and break down goals into actionable steps, most of our teams use Scrum.


  

  

**Who We’re Looking For** 
  

  

 We’re looking for a confident Ruby developer who thrives in a collaborative team environment, someone who enjoys solving real problems and delivering clear value together with our agile development team.
   

  

 You have:
   

  

* Several years of experience as a system developer in a commercial setting.
* Solid hands-on experience with Ruby.
* Knowledge of software design principles, automated testing, and CI/CD.
* Familiarity with PostgreSQL, Docker and cloud infrastructure (we’re on AWS).
* You understand the importance of time-to-market, performance, code quality and team collaboration.
* You prefer working in iterative development cycles and incremental deployments.
* You’re used to working in agile, cross-functional teams.


  

  

 It’s a plus if you already have:
   

  

* Experience with Node.js.
* Knowledge of GraphQL, experience building or using APIs in that format.
* Interest in AI-powered developer tools (e.g. ChatGPT, GitHub Copilot, Claude Code).


  

  

**Who You Are** 
  

  

 We value curiosity, creativity, and a collaborative mindset. You’re comfortable sharing ideas, supporting colleagues, and driving initiatives forward together. You enjoy contributing to both the technical and cultural strength of your team.
   

  

**I am your new manager 👋** 
  

  

 My name is Johan Boberg, I joined Hemnet in June, prior to Hemnet I worked at Blocket for many years. I have a long career behind me as Engineering Manager and before that, as Backend Developer.
   

  

 As a manager, I am supportive and humble, my goal is to create an environment where you can feel trusted, be challenged and empowered to grow. My job is to lead the team to a productive and creative space where everyone can contribute.
   

  

**A Note on Inclusion 💚** 
  

  

 At Hemnet, we believe that diversity in gender, sexual orientation, ability, neurodiversity, cultural background and life experience makes us stronger. We welcome applicants of all identities and backgrounds.
   

  

 If you meet many but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to apply. We value curiosity, a strong sense of purpose and the motivation to learn and grow, alongside your skills and experiences.
   

  

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: System Engineer med systemansvar till team Rådgivning på IT Liv och Pension
description:
Vill du jobba i ett stabilt företag där vi satsar mycket på IT? Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med integrationer, produktleverantör och utveckling i en komplex IT-miljö? Då kan vi erbjuda dig ett intressant arbete med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter i en stimulerande miljö då vi nu satsar på att förflytta hela vår affär in i framtiden.
 



  





 Ditt uppdrag och ansvar som System Engineer med systemansvar är att utveckla och modernisera våra IT-lösningar genom att arbeta nära tekniken och leveransen, närmast med Folksams rådgivningsverktyg – Råd1. Rollen som System Engineer hos oss motsvarar System Architect / systemarkitekt i andra företag. Du är även systemansvarig för Råd1 och genomför revisioner, systemkontroller och liknande. Folksam IT arbetar efter en agil filosofi där du och ditt team får ett stort mandat i kraft av er kompetens. Råd1 är ett strategiskt utpekat målsystem med hög prioritet och som har stort affärs- och kundnära värde.
 



  





**Det här gör du som System Engineer med systemansvar på Folksam** 




 Som System Engineer med systemansvar ansvarar du för förvaltning och drift av applikationen och dess tekniska plattform (Windows och Linux). I detta ingår infrastruktur, integrationer, incidenthantering och driftsättning och du arbetar för ordning och reda. Du ansvarar och arbetar operativt för att systemet ligger i linje med arkitekturell vision och roadmap och du säkerställer att arkitektur- och teknikarbetet följer affärssatsningar och andra gemensamma förflyttningsområden. Ditt ansvar innefattar även att lösningarna lever upp till icke-funktionella krav, till exempel krav på tillgänglighet, kostnader, kontinuitet och säkerhet. Du kommer också att arbeta med vad teamet i övrigt har i åtagande.
 



  





 Du är en teammedlem i ett mindre team i vårt utvecklingsområde. Stor del av tiden lägger du på att arbeta med vidareutveckling av befintliga arkitekturella lösningar samt implementering och dokumentation av dessa lösningar. Du ansvarar för livscykelhantering av applikationen och att proaktivt lösa tekniska utmaningar tillsammans med arkitekter, utvecklare (hos vår leverantör) och andra relevanta områden på Folksam. Tillsammans med teamet jobbar du även med att stärka dess tekniska förmåga så att vi kan skapa mer värde på kortare tid till kund.
 



 I denna roll säkerställer du även regelefterlevnad med interna och externa regelverk. Detta primärt i och med genomförandet av systemkontroller, revisioner och hög hygiennivå på våra processer i och kring systemet.
 



  





**Är du den vi söker?** 




 Du motiveras av att arbeta med tekniska lösningar, på djupet och operativt. Du har ett uttalat självledarskap och tar på ett självklart sätt till dig ny information och kunskap. Du är orädd och agerar snabbt och vågar ta beslut.
 



  





 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av applikationer och infrastruktur och då främst Windowsplattformen
* Erfarenhet av teknik, utvecklings- och/eller plattformsarbete enligt standardiserade metoder
* Förståelse för hur man designar och använder sig av API:er
* Förståelse av moderna plattformar (t ex Azure) samt traditionell serverinfrastruktur
* Erfarenhet av monitoreringsstöd och logghantering
* Kunskap kring design av robusta och säkra tekniska lösningar enligt regulatoriska krav (privacy & security by design)
* Erfarenhet av risk och compliance
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt och gärna erfarenhet av att jobba skalat
* Kunskap om ITIL



  





 Du är en naturlig nätverkare och kommunikativ i både tal och skrift. Du brinner för ordning, struktur och spårbarhet – och har förmågan att skapa tydliga processer som gör arbetet enklare för alla. Vi tror att du trivs bäst när du får ta eget ansvar och vara självledande. Du är initiativtagande, lösningsorienterad och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till andra. Samtidigt är du ödmjuk och nyfiken på andras perspektiv. Du är pedagogisk, har lätt för att förklara komplexa saker på ett enkelt sätt och vet hur man når fram med ett tydligt budskap.
 



  





 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har en stark team känsla där du arbetar självständigt och tar ansvar för dina uppgifter, samtidigt som du är prestigelös och bidrar aktivt till gemensamma mål. Hos oss är samverkan en självklarhet, och vi värdesätter kollegor som stöttar varandra och hugger i där det behövs.
 



  





**Här kan du göra skillnad** 




 Välkommen till Folksam – här driver du viktiga frågor framåt. Från de avgörande detaljerna till de stora perspektiven, med fokus på att förenkla våra kunders vardag. Det gör att du bidrar till något större, oavsett roll. Här finns det många roliga, utvecklande jobb och du har goda chanser till en spännande karriär.
 



  





 Vi tror på ett hållbart arbetsliv och jobbar aktivt med inkludering och mångfald. Våra moderna kontor bjuder in till samarbete och lärande, här får vi saker att hända! Du har flexibiliteten att kunna varva arbete på kontoret med att jobba hemifrån, utifrån verksamhetens behov.
 



 Läs mer och se filmer om livet hos oss på folksam.se/jobb-och-karriar.
 



  





**Så söker du jobbet** 




 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan senast den 19 oktober 2025. Vi gör urval till intervju löpande under ansökningstiden, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag.
 



  





 För att söka tjänsten ber vi dig bifoga ditt CV och besvara ett antal frågor som utgår från aktuell kravprofil. Vid första urval kommer vi endast att utgå ifrån ditt CV och dina svar på frågorna. Vi önskar att du svarar konkret och kortfattat, och att det finns en tydlig koppling mellan dina svar och ditt CV.
 



  





 Vill du veta mer om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta gruppchef Marika Skytte Af Sätra 070-831 50 85.
